cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 80 mi (125 km) east of Chetumal, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn north through the Yucatan Channel on Sunday–Monday and then track north-north-eastward across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle

weather_observation.watch_coast: Coast of Mexico from Tulum to Cabo Catoche
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio and the Isle of Youth
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Gulf Coast from west-central Florida northward to Louisiana, greatest threat Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤8%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; brief gusts possible late Tuesday into Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along west-central Florida coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could produce 1–3 inches of rain beginning Monday night
